intro: Clinopodium amabile, commonly known as sweet germander, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, tubular flowers are usually pink or purple and appear in whorled clusters, blooming from late spring to early summer. The leaves and flowers are used in herbal medicine for their mild sedative and digestive properties.
